text: - Hello, everyone.
My name is Abdul Qadir.
I'm an AWS Solutions architect.
Today we are going to learn
how IVS can accelerate
their customer's generative AI journey,

and provide them intelligent
assistant feature
using Amazon Q index and Q embedded.
Before I talk about Amazon Q index,

let me give you a brief
overview of Amazon Q Business.
Q Business is the most capable
generative AI powered assistant
for finding information, gaining insight,
and taking action at work.

It helps make your organizational
data more accessible
with the ability to combine insights,

and answer questions
across every data source
in the organization.

It can also generate
content, solve problems,
and take actions across applications.

Q Business is built with
security and privacy in mind
from the start,
making it easier for organizations
to use generative AI safely.
Amazon Q has prebuilt connectors
for enterprise data systems,

and you can find latest
list of available connectors
on the AWS websites.

From employee productivity
to end customer experiences.

Generative AI is no longer
just an internal employee need.
Customer demand is driving the evaluation
of Amazon Q Business

to support enhancing and
customer experiences.
Based on customer feedback,

Amazon Q business is
enabling application builders
to embed Q capabilities

directly into their
products and platforms,

going beyond just internal
employee productivity use cases.
This shift has required new thinking
around authentication, and pathways,

for seamlessly integrating
the Q experience,

ensuring a secure and personalized
experience for end users.
Let us talk about how Amazon Q index
can be used to increase the productivity.

According to Gartner
survey of 4,800 employees,

the average desk worker
uses 11 applications
to complete their tasks,
up from six in 2019.
Despite the expanded tool set they have,
half of employees say

they struggle to find
the information they need
to complete work.

Q index provides comprehensive
cross app insights
across your various SaaS applications.

We know that some of
enterprise applications

already have their own
generative AI assistance,
but Enterprise wants to provide them

a secure way to access data
from other applications
to make those assistants work better.
And Enterprise aim to achieve this

without granting each
application permission

to create its own separate
index of Enterprise data,
and Enterprise want to do it

without allowing each
one of those applications

access to create a separate
index of your Enterprise data.
Here is the high level architecture
of how integration works.
ISV application environment
has the generative AI application.

Let us say it's a Zoom
conferencing platform.
ISV customer will have its own Q index
running in their own AWS accounts.

ISV customers can bring
in their Enterprise data
into a single index store
from different sources
that is governed and managed
with high security and privacy
using available connectors.
ISV platform become the data accessor,
and ISV customer provide the permission

to access their Q index
using the retrieve API.
Now ISV application platform can access
their customer data from Q index,

and returns the relevant semantic
and keyword search results

to ISV customer users that
they are authorized to.
As you can see in this integration,

end customer is owning, and
governing, its own Q index.
However, there is another option

where ISV customers allow
ISV to manage their Q index.

In this case, ISV will manage
their customer's Q indexes
in their own AWS account,
and manage the connectivity

to their customer's underlying
data sources and systems.
Please look at the AWS documentations
to learn more about these options.
Now that we discussed about Q index,

and how ISV Enterprise
data can be stored there,
let us learn about end user experiences
using Amazon Q embedded.
Amazon Q embedded is a feature

that lets you embed the
Amazon Q business assistant
within websites that you trust.
If you have a company intranet website,
you can create Amazon Q Web experience
by using your company data.

You can then embed with web
experience on your website.

Your users can log into
the chat experience
using their company credentials,

and ask the embedded
Amazon Q business chat
experience questions.

A few ways to build
generative AI experience

in your platform, or products,
with Amazon Q business.
Number one,

Amazon Q experience in
your app using iframe,
for customers that need to move fast,
don't have UI builders.

Number two, Amazon Q
experience in your app
using ChatSync API

for customers that want
a virtual assistant,
and want to leverage data from Q,

but want to build their own
assistant from a UI standpoint.
Number three, Amazon Q data in your app,

for customers with
existing virtual experience
that want to leverage Q data.
You can match applications, look and feel,
select customization options,

manage themes using
cascading style sheets.

You can perform these
customizations using,
either the AWS Management console,

or Amazon QAPI available via
the AWSSDK rest API and AWSCLI.

The ChatSync API allows
user to send prompts,
and receive generative AI response.

It enables customization
of the user experience
to meet unique requirements

while leveraging the
managed infrastructure
of Amazon Q business.
The result.

Productivity applications can
now consume enterprise data
from an Amazon Q index

to enhances their abilities
to answer questions,

summarize, and take actions
from data across sources.

As we get close to the end
of our presentation today,
let's recap what we learned.

Amazon Q Business offers key
benefits for software providers
by driving top-line growth,
enhancing app experience,

enabling innovation, and
improving AI results.

It helps onboard customers
enrich generative AI features,

and ensure full control
over user experience
with personalized app experience.
By eliminating integration complexities,
and providing secure data access,

it allows businesses
to focus on innovation.

Additionally, it enhances
the quality, and usefulness,
of AI features,

making applications more
effective and intelligent.

Learn more about Amazon Q
Business and its features.
Please use the QR codes or links.
Thank you for watching the presentation.
